= Environment setup =

 # Get the SSH private key [https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/continuous-delivery/continuous-delivery-workshop.pem continuous-delivery-workshop.pem] to connect to the servers
 {{{
mkdir ~/.aws/
curl https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/continuous-delivery/continuous-delivery-workshop.pem --output ~/.aws/continuous-delivery-workshop.pem
chmod 400 ~/.aws/continuous-delivery-workshop.pem
}}}
 # Clone Github repository xebia-petclinic-lite-10
  {{{
mkdir ~/continuous-delivery-workshop
cd ~/continuous-delivery-workshop
git clone https://xebia-guest@github.com/xebia-guest/xebia-petclinic-lite-10.git
}}}
  Note: password of the "xebia-guest" user will be sent before the workshop.
 # build project
 {{{
cd ~/continuous-delivery-workshop/xebia-petclinic-lite-10
mvn package
}}}
 # Modify the welcome page and push the change
  ## Modify {{{~/continuous-delivery-workshop/xebia-petclinic-lite-10/src/main/webapp/welcome.jsp}}}
  ## Push the change
   {{{
xebia-petclinic-lite-10 > git commit -m "test" src/main/webapp/welcome.jsp
xebia-petclinic-lite-10 > git push
}}}
 # Verify that Jenkins detects the Git change and triggers a build : [http://ec2-176-34-164-205.eu-west-1.compute.amazonaws.com:8080//job/xebia-petclinic-lite-10/] (it may take up to 1 minute).
 # Do a release of the application
  ## Add the Nexus credentials to your Maven settings.xml file :
   {{{
<settings>
  <servers>
    <!-- Xebia Workshop -->
    <server>
      <id>xebia-tech-event-nexus-releases</id>
      <username>deployment</username>
      <password>deployment123</password>
    </server>
    <server>
      <id>xebia-tech-event-nexus-snapshots</id>
      <username>deployment</username>
      <password>deployment123</password>
    </server>
  </servers>
</settings>
}}}
  ## Execute {{{mvn release:prepare -B release:perform}}}
 # Verify that the new release is available in Nexus : [http://nexus.aws.xebia-tech-event.info:8081/nexus/content/groups/public/fr/xebia/demo/petclinic-10/xebia-petclinic-lite/]
